file_content.text: Finally. Let's relax and kick off our boots.
Noise, heat, sweat. I can hear their beating hearts.
Off-duty soldiers, scared locals... they try to hide it, but they're shell-shocked. Just waiting for something to blow up.
Braden, Jory and I would always end up in places like this after a successful bounty. Jory said, "Spend your credits while you still can, little girl." Good advice.
Welcome to the war zone. Get ready for a bumpy ride.
I remember the craters and trenches of Yn and Chabosh. The terror of the dying. It was glorious.
I thought this place was supposed to be pacified--we're in the middle of a war zone.
I hope they don't have to use those guns while we're here.
Makes me grateful to be with you. I would not want to work here on the best of days.
Is this what the Empire calls war? Hiding in a warehouse?
Guess this is Troida. Probably a lot nicer before the occupation, but you take what you can get....
Looks like the fighting hasn't slowed production here much. They must put out a ton of armament per day.
I'm guessing this place has seen better days. Then again, maybe not.
Where is the glory in capturing a heap of junk?
That's a lot of slag. So glad I'm not in the salvage business anymore.
Kinda reminds you of Hutta, huh? Not as soggy, but just as much junk.
Great view--let's see... we got rocks, and some more rocks....
The claws of Balmorra scream for blood.
You smell that? Scorched metal, chems, dead things. Don't lean over.
Those trenches look huge enough to drive a walker through! Can you imagine what this must've been like during a full-scale invasion?
Even safe areas on this planet feel like the place could go up in flames at any moment.
Do not delay, little master. Take, conquer, kill.
Brave little Imps in the middle of a war. Want to play with them?
Never seen an ion cannon this close before... you don't think that's going to fry my implants if we get too close, do you?
Hmm, a lot more goes into making a droid than I ever thought.
That reminds me of my cage on Korriban. Let's move on.
What do you say we pop that thing, make the whole place burn?
That doesn't exactly look stable, and with all the droids going berserk, I don't want to be anywhere near it if it melts down.
A camp with no campfire? What's this world coming to?
Cower, little Imperials. Cower.
Let's take a break, all right? I want to check my weapons while the shooting's stopped.
I don't envy these guys. Nothing but a couple tents between them and some berserk droids or a resistance ambush. Not the ideal place to be camping.
Gee, you think they got enough guns to protect this place?
I think we have found the secret to raining death from the sky.
Nice rig. Wanna kill everyone, try to pick up pirate HoloNet channels?
Ugh, this place is giving my link all sorts of interference. Records say this is the control tower for Balmorra's planetary defense satellites.
This place smells even worse than it looks. And that is saying a lot.
This place is poisoned.
That stuff is foul. Takes brass to live here, though--spitting up green goo every morning and going out to fight.
Well, isn't that a healthy shade of green... looks like the waste is leaking from that factory over there.
I ever tell you I have a fear of being stomped to death by bugs?
Creatures bred for war. At last, some worthy opponents.
We used to eat bugs back home, sometimes. Knife the shell, crack it open, suck down the guts. I hated it.
This doesn't add up, I found a couple of small entries on the Colicoids. They sound like a sentient species... not like this.
I have one thing to say--yuck. Scratch that, two things--yuck and ugh.
This is a nest. The queen must be near.
How many of these things are there? This planet's gonna get eaten alive.
Oh boy, I think the noxious coat of slime on everything is the least of our worries... coming in here was such a bad idea.
It's nice to find a little oasis in the middle of all this crazy.
You walk as a giant among worms, little Sith.
Here's what I figure--the guys with rank stay under the shield dome. The grunts get assigned out here. What does that make us?
Balmorra's not so bad sans the shooting. I bet it was downright pleasant before all this fighting started.
If I was on the lam, this is where I'd hide. Don't tell anyone.
Murder in the dark.
Ash in the soil and a gun in my hands. Let's go.
Wonder what was going on out here. Think this used to be a Balmorran resistance camp?
The enemy sure has nice digs. Bet the Imperials are jealous.
Let's drive the Balmorran rebels away in terror.
Now this is a base. Won't be when we're done with it.
Think they've got enough flags? If they had as many soldiers, we might actually have a problem.
You'd think a war happened here or something. Just a wild guess.
The smoke of the battlefield, the smell of death. It's almost as if my master were alive.
Look at this: It's my new favorite playground.
This... this is awful. We aren't going through that, are we? I don't want to end up another forgotten body in this no-man's-land.
If you're looking for a little trench warfare--and really, who isn't?--this is the place for you.
You cannot hide, little Balmorrans.
Do I look like a trench rat? There's fun, there's stupid and there's suicidal. This is just stupid.
I hear trench warfare is as bad as it gets. Cowering in a dirty hole hoping a bombardment doesn't hit too close, or penned in with dozens of others desperately fighting with nowhere to go....
This place is immense. Something tells me we're going to be here for a while.
This is the great fortress of the Balmorran rebels?
Some kind of control center. Don't really care about the details so long as the sparks fly.
This place isn't a factory, it's a fortress. I don't think the Balmorran freedom fighters could maintain a stronghold like this without outside help.
Pretty desolate, huh? Empire sure did a number on this place.
The Empire still has the power to destroy.
Nasty place. Hear those things scuttling around... might want to check your gun battery.
Uh, looks like this place has been resettled. I suppose it's too much to hope these Colicoids are the reasonable kind.
Yeah, if I were a freaky mutated bug, this is where I'd want to be. No question.
Are you sure it's wise to swim in this substance?
I don't know what's in there, and I don't really want to. Balmorrans locked it down for a reason.
Ick, try not to breathe that. That's a hazard vault. It's where factories store the dangerous waste that can't be processed.
